page.title: 05 Transport through Radcot
page.content: The A4095 and the River Thames are the two main routes of transport for the area. There is also a minor interchange to the B4495.Heavy lorries and coaches are unable to negotiate the bridges at Radcot. Vehicles with an axle weight exceeding 6 tons are prohibited. The A4095 connects Carterton and Faringdon ,the two largest towns on the outskirts of this area. Narrowboats and motor cruisers ply this stretch of the Thames in the holiday season. There is access down to the river off the road that goes to Littleworth. Oxfordshire County Council is responsible for the roads, whilst the Thames Water Authority is responsible for the lock not far from Radcot Bridge.
